snippet: Alan Lapes, a major private operator of homeless shelters in New York City, runs them as a for-profit organization, charging the city many times what the rooms would normally rent for.
abstract: Alan Lapes, one of several private operators of homeless shelters in New York City, runs them as a for-profit organization, charging the city many times what rooms would take in from standard tenants; Lapes and others are capitalizing on a shortage of shelters, and regulations that require the city to find a roof for every homeless person.
lead_paragraph: Alan Lapes, a major private operator of homeless shelters in New York City, runs them as a for-profit organization, charging the city many times what the rooms would normally rent for.

headline.seo: For Some Landlords, Real Money in the Homeless
headline.main: For Some Landlords, Real Money in the Homeless
headline.print_headline: For Some Landlords, Real Money in the Homeless
